FAIL_TO_PASS: when positiveOption with FALSE then return false
when imply from lone negative option then negative implied
when implies on program and use subcommand then program updated
when source from env and implied undefined then implied is implied
when imply non-option then ok and stored
when negativeOption with string then return false
when positiveOption with false then return false
when passed string then treat as boolean
when source cli and implied default then implied is implied
when chained implies then only explicitly trigger
when negativeOption with true then return false
when imply multiple times then store multiple values
when imply from positive option then positive implied
when source cli and env default then implied is env
when requiredOption with implied value then not throw
when imply multiple values then store multiple values
when implied option has custom processing then custom processing not called
when option with implies used multiple times then implied gets single value
when source from cli and implied undefined then implied is implied
when looped implies then no infinite loop
